required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Drug Use Investigation Of Varenicline (Regulatory Post Marketing Commitment Plan)
clinical_study.official_title: Drug Use Investigation Of Champix (Regulatory Post Marketing Commitment Plan)

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this surveillance is to collect information about 1) adverse drug reaction not expected from the LPD (unknown adverse drug reaction), 2) the incidence of adverse drug reactions in this surveillance, and 3)factors considered to affect the safety and/or efficacy of this drug.

detailed_description.textblock: All the patients whom an investigator prescribes the first Varenicline(Champix) should be registered consecutively until the number of subjects reaches target number in order to extract patients enrolled into the investigation at random.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Gender.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether gender is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Age.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether age is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease as a Complication.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Concomitant Drugs.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether taking concomitant drugs is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Concomitant Therapies.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether receiving concomitant therapies is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Weight at Baseline.
primary_outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events to determine whether weight at baseline is a significant risk factor.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Tobacco Consumption Per Day.
primary_outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Prolonged Administration After 12 Weeks.
primary_outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug.
primary_outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Related Adverse Events.
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events mean all unfavorable events that occur in participants after administration of Varenicline, irrespective of causal relationship to Varenicline (including clinically problematic abnormal changes in laboratory test values). Treatment related Adverse Events were evaluated in company with the causal relationship to Varenicline. The safety was evaluated on the first visit after 24 weeks; however, it was evaluated on the last visit for those who had stopped visiting before 24 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Unlisted Treatment Related Adverse Events According to Japanese Package Insert.
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events mean all unfavorable events that occur in participants after administration of Varenicline, irrespective of causal relationship to Varenicline (including clinically problematic abnormal changes in laboratory test values). Numbers of Treatment Related Adverse Events were evaluated in company with the causal relationship to Varenicline. Unlisted treatment related adverse events were confirmed with listed adverse drug reaction in Japanese package insert. The safety was evaluated on the first visit after 24 weeks; however, it was evaluated on the last visit for those who had stopped visiting before 24 weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Continuous Abstinence Situation by 52 Weeks.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with dependence on Varenicline by 52 weeks. Varenicline-dependent Treatment Related Adverse Events are Feeling abnormal, Feeling drunk, Feeling jittery, Disturbance in attention, Dizziness, Memory impairment, Mental impairment, Psychomotor hyperactivity, Sedation, Somnolence, Confusional state, Depersonalisation, Disorientation, Dissociation, Euphoric mood, Mood variable, Mood swings, and Hallucination.

intervention.description: Champix Tablets 0.5mg or Champix Tablets 1mg, depending on the Investigator prescription. Frequency and duration are according to Package Insert as follows. "The usual adult dosage for oral use is 0.5 mg of varenicline once daily after eating for days 1 to 3, 0.5 mg twice daily after eating in the morning and evening for days 4 to 7, and 1 mg twice daily after eating in the morning and evening on and after day 8. The drug should be administered to patients for 12 weeks."

study_pop.textblock: The patients whom an investigator involving A3051109 prescribes the Varenicline(Champix).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients need to be administered Varenicline(Champix) in order to be enrolled in the surveillance.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not administered Varenicline(Champix).

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Participants taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Varenicline
group.description: Participants taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Gender.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether gender is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

group.title: Male
group.description: Male participants taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Female
group.description: Female participants taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Gender.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether gender is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "Gender". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "Male and Female" in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Age.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether age is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

group.title: <65 Years
group.description: Participants with <65 years taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: >=65 Years
group.description: Participants with >=65 years taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Age.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether age is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "Age". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "<65 years and >=65 years" in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease as a Complication.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

group.title: Varenicline - With Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
group.description: Participants with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Varenicline - Without Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
group.description: Participants without chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease as a Complication.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "Varenicline with and without Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease as a complication" in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Concomitant Drugs.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether taking concomitant drugs is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

group.title: Varenicline - With Concomitant Drugs
group.description: Participants taking concomitant drugs while taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Varenicline - Without Concomitant Drugs
group.description: Participants taking no concomitant drugs while taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Concomitant Drugs.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether taking concomitant drugs is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "concomitant drugs". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "Varenicline with and without concomitant drugs" in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Concomitant Therapies.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether receiving concomitant therapies is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

group.title: Varenicline - With Concomitant Therapies
group.description: Participants receiving concomitant therapies while taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Varenicline - Without Concomitant Therapies
group.description: Participants receiving no concomitant therapies while taking Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events – Concomitant Therapies.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events of Varenicline to determine whether receiving concomitant therapies is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "concomitant therapies". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "Varenicline with and without concomitant therapies" in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Weight at Baseline.
outcome.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events to determine whether weight at baseline is a significant risk factor.
outcome.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed. The number of participants who provided weight data at baseline was 1700.

group.title: <40 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were less than 40 kg.

group.title: >=40 kg and <50 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were more than or equal to 40 kg and less than 50 kg.

group.title: >=50 kg and <60 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were more than or equal to 50 kg and less than 60 kg.

group.title: >=60 kg and <70 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were more than or equal to 60 kg and less than 70 kg.

group.title: >=70 kg and <80 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were more than or equal to 70 kg and less than 80 kg.

group.title: >= 80 kg at Baseline
group.description: Participants whose weights at baseline were more than or equal to 80 kg.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events - Weight at Baseline.
measure.description: Number of participants with Treatment Related Adverse Events to determine whether weight at baseline is a significant risk factor.
measure.population: The safety analysis population consists of the participants who satisfy the case conditions and in whom administration of this drug was confirmed. The number of participants who provided weight data at baseline was 1700.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "Weight at Baseline". The null hypothesis is that there is no association between "Weight at Baseline and the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events".

The risk factor tested was "Weight at Baseline". The null hypothesis is that there is no linear trend in the frequency of Treatment Related Adverse Events across increasing levels of Weight at Baseline.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Tobacco Consumption Per Day.
outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants who provided data on daily tobacco consumption was 2827.

group.title: <=20 Cigarettes Per Day
group.description: Participants with <=20 cigarettes per day during treatment with Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: >=21 and <=40 Cigarettes Per Day
group.description: Participants with >=21 and <=40 cigarettes per day during treatment with Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: >=41 Cigarettes Per Day
group.description: Participants with >=41 cigarettes per day during treatment with Varenicline according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Tobacco Consumption Per Day.
measure.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants who provided data on daily tobacco consumption was 2827.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "Tobacco consumption per day". The null hypothesis is that there is no association between "Tobacco consumption per day and the efficacy of Varenicline".
The risk factor tested was "Tobacco consumption per day". The null hypothesis is that there is no linear trend in the efficacy of Varenicline across increasing levels of tobacco consumption per day.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders – Prolonged Administration After 12 Weeks.
outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants in whom the prolonged administration of Varenicline after 12 weeks was confirmed was 2598.

group.title: Administration Prolonged After 12 Weeks
group.description: Participants with prolonged administration of Varenicline after 12 weeks according to Japanese Package Insert.

group.title: Administration Not Prolonged After 12 Weeks
group.description: Participants without prolonged administration of Varenicline after 12 weeks according to Japanese Package Insert.

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders – Prolonged Administration After 12 Weeks.
measure.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants in whom the prolonged administration of Varenicline after 12 weeks was confirmed was 2598.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "prolonged administration after 12 weeks". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "administration prolonged after 12 weeks and administration not prolonged after 12 weeks" in the efficacy of Varenicline.

outcome.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug.
outcome.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
outcome.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants who provided data on concomitant administration of antipsychotics was 2842.

group.title: Varenicline - With Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug
group.description: Varenicline with Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug

group.title: Varenicline - Without Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug
group.description: Varenicline without Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug

measure.title: Risk Factors for the Proportion of Responders - Antipsychotics as a Concomitant Drug.
measure.description: The primary analysis item was "the number of participants succeeding with continuous smoking cessation for the previous 4 weeks/the number of participants for efficacy evaluation excluding drop-out participants.
measure.population: The efficacy analysis population basically consists of the evaluable participants in accordance with the separately prepared analysis plan (participants judged to have been evaluated appropriately). The number of participants who provided data on concomitant administration of antipsychotics was 2842.

analysis.groups_desc: The risk factor tested was "antipsychotics as a concomitant drug". The null hypothesis is that there is no difference between "Varenicline with and without antipsychotics as a concomitant drug" in the efficacy of Varenicline.

outcome.description: Adverse events mean all unfavorable events that occur in participants after administration of Varenicline, irrespective of causal relationship to Varenicline (including clinically problematic abnormal changes in laboratory test values). Treatment related Adverse Events were evaluated in company with the causal relationship to Varenicline. The safety was evaluated on the first visit after 24 weeks; however, it was evaluated on the last visit for those who had stopped visiting before 24 weeks.

reported_events.desc: The frequency of treatment related adverse events during the study.

group.title: Varenicline

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
